member.name: T:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HoverTracker
member.summary: Helper class to track mouse movements and to hide a tip window when mouse goes out of baundaries of the control. Instance of this class is not responsible for hiding hyperTooltip window it just tracks mouse and fire "Hoverout" event when mouse pointer goes put of boundaries. Instance of this class typically reused for all tip popups on the form because tip popups are shown one after another (not semultenously) that is why control and popup to track is not passed in the constructor, method should be called to start actual tracking.

member.name: M:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HoverTracker.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Contructs tracker instance. Instance of this class typically reused for all tip popups on the form because tip popups are shown one after another (not semultenously) that is why control and popup to track is not passed in the constructor, method should be called to start actual tracking.

member.name: M:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HoverTracker.Finalize
member.summary: Finalizes an instance of the class.

member.name: T:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HoverTracker.TrackerEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that will handle the events of a .

member.name: E:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HoverTracker.TrackingStopped
member.summary: Occurs right after tracking is stoped, because e.g. mouse goes out of boundaries of the tracked region. This event is fired also if tracking is cancelled or stopped by any other reason. Typically this event is used to hide tooltip popup window.

member.name: P:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HoverTracker.CheckInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets time interval in ms used to check mouse movements. Default is 100ms.
member.value: Time interval in ms used to check mouse movements

member.name: P:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HoverTracker.Control
member.value: Control (UI element) beeing tracked. null if nothing tracked currently.

member.name: P:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HoverTracker.Popup
member.value: window beeing tracked. null if nothing tracked currently.

member.name: P:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HoverTracker.Tracking
member.summary: Whether the instance currently tracking mouse movements or not?
member.value: true if mouse movements are tracking currently

member.name: M:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HoverTracker.Dispose
member.summary: Implements IDisposable. Do not make this method virtual. A derived class should not be able to override this method.

member.name: M:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HoverTracker.Start(System.Object,Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.Popup)
member.summary: Starts tracking for mouse movements. When mouse pointer goes out of both control and tip window boundaries then event is fired. If this instance of tracker is currently tracking something else then current tracker is stoped ( fired) and new one is started.
member.param: UI element/control for which tooltip is displayed
member.exception: control or hyperWnd arguments is null

member.name: M:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HoverTracker.Stop
member.summary: Stops tracking (don't destroy/hide tracked popup), do nothing if nothing is tracked currently. Fire event.

member.name: M:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HoverTracker.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose(bool disposing) executes in two distinct scenarios. If disposing equals true, the method has been called directly or indirectly by a user's code. Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed. If disposing equals false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside the finalizer and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.

member.value: The to be shown.
member.remarks: You can modify properties of the window to alter the tip before it is shown.

member.name: T:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.TipLoader
member.summary:
Helper class to prepare a form for HyperToolTips support. Allow to attache HyperToolTips to all UI elements on the form. Enumerates all controls and toolbars inside form and attachs nesessary handles to show/hide tooltips to each control. Controls Tag property is used as a TipContextId. For all s and s with not empty tags tooltip is attached.
These helpers can be used to add HyperToolTips programmically on runtime, but it is not recomended, design time support in should be used instead.

member.name: M:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.TipLoader.PopulateWithAllControls(System.Windows.Forms.Form,Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HyperToolTipProvider)
member.summary: Populate hyper tooltips provider with all s and s found on the form. UI element's Tag property is used as HyperToolTipId.

member.name: M:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.TipLoader.PopulateWithToolbars(System.Windows.Forms.Form,Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HyperToolTipProvider)
member.summary: Populate hyper tooltips provider with all toolbars found on the form.'s Tag property is used as HyperToolTipId. Attaches tooltips only to toolbar on the form.

member.name: T:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HyperToolTipProvider
member.summary:
This class is similar to standard , it provides support for attaching HyperToolTips to various UI elements ( and are supported at the moment).
Typically is populated by autogenerated designer code. You have to drop to or in VS designer and then fill HyperToolTipId property for each UI element you want to have a HyperToolTip.
can be used also to populate with controls in form, but it is not recomended way to use .

member.name: M:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HyperToolTipProvider.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Initializes a new instance of the without a specified container.
member.remarks: The constructor associates the class with the container that is creating the instance of the control.

member.name: M:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HyperToolTipProvider.#ctor(System.ComponentModel.IContainer)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified container.
member.param: An that represents the container of the
member.remarks: The constructor enables you to associate a with any container. A releases its resources when its container closes or is finalized.

member.name: T:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HyperToolTipProvider.TipEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that will handle the events of a .

member.name: E:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HyperToolTipProvider.TipPopup
member.summary: Occurs before a HyperToolTip is displayed. This event can be used to prevent tooltip from being displayed or to change apperance and/or content.

member.name: P:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HyperToolTipProvider.Active
member.summary: Controls whether hyper tooltips should be displayed or not.
member.value: true. if the HyperTooltip is currently active; otherwise, false.. The default is true..
member.remarks: With the Active property, you can enable or disable the display of HyperTooltip text for all controls that have text specified by this particular component. Although more than one component can be created and assigned to a form, setting the Active. property to false. only affects the current . You can enable users to set the value of this property in a form that provides application options. These options, in turn, provide the user with the ability to enable or disable the display of HyperTooltips in your application.

member.name: P:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HyperToolTipProvider.Debug
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating debug execution mode. Debug mode to be used by documentation team to get information about TipContextIds associated with controls. When true. TipContextId value is placed to clipboard on mouse over the control and SHIFT pressed.
member.value: value indicating debug execution mode.

member.name: P:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HyperToolTipProvider.FadingInterval
member.summary: Get/set total fading time in milleseconds. The bigger number the slower fading is. should be set to true. to turn fading effect on.
member.value: Total time of fading interval in milleseconds.

member.name: P:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HyperToolTipProvider.InitialDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time which passes, in milliseconds, before a tip is displayed.
member.value: The period of time, in milliseconds, that the pointer must remain stationary on a control before the ToolTip window is displayed.
member.remarks: With the InitialDelay property, you can shorten or lengthen the time that the ToolTip waits before displaying a ToolTip window. If the value of the InitialDelay property is set to a value that is too long in duration, the user of your application might not know that your application provides ToolTip Help. You can use this property to ensure that the user has ToolTips displayed quickly by shortening the time specified.

member.name: P:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HyperToolTipProvider.Opacity
member.summary: Get/set opacity for tooltip window. If is true. this is a maximum opacity.
member.value: Opacity for tooltip window.

member.name: P:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HyperToolTipProvider.PopupSizeLarge
member.summary: Get/set a large size for popup tooltip window. This size is used in case othervise is not specified.
member.value: Size of the popup window with HypetTooltip used in case '_l' suffix is added to html file name.

member.name: P:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HyperToolTipProvider.PopupSizeNormal
member.summary: Get/set a normal size for popup tooltip window. This size is used in case othervise is not specified.
member.value: Size of the popup window with HypetTooltip used in case othervise is not specified.

member.name: P:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HyperToolTipProvider.ReshowDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time that must transpire before subsequent ToolTip windows appear as the mouse pointer moves from one control to another.
member.value: The length of time (in milliseconds) that it takes subsequent ToolTip windows to appear.
member.remarks: This property enables you to shorten or lengthen the time that the ToolTip waits before displaying a ToolTip window after a previous ToolTip window is displayed. The first time a ToolTip window is displayed the value of the property is used to determine the delay to apply before initially showing the ToolTip window. When a ToolTip window is currently being displayed and the user moves the cursor to another control that displays a ToolTip window, the value of the property is used before showing the ToolTip for the new control. The ToolTip window from the previous control must still be displayed in order for the delay specified in the property to be used; otherwise the InitialDelay property value is used.

member.name: P:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HyperToolTipProvider.ShowAlways
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a HyperToolTip window is displayed, even when its parent control is not active.
member.value: true. if the HyperToolTip is always displayed; otherwise, false.. The default is false..

member.name: P:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HyperToolTipProvider.TipsNamespace
member.summary: Gets or sets a value specifying the name of the Help file to get tips' content from.
member.value: The name of the Help file. This can be of the form C:\path\tooltips.chm or /folder/sample.chm.
member.remarks: The file name retrieved by this method identifies the file that provides HyperTooltip support for all the controls for which this object provides Tips. This file name can designate a compiled Help (.chm). use this propety to build full url to the tip content.

member.name: P:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HyperToolTipProvider.UseFading
member.summary: Get/set whether to use fadding while show tooltip window. is used to define the speed of fading.
member.value: true. indicates fadding will be used.

member.summary: Indicates whether this object can provide its extender properties to the specified object. This class can extend and .
member.param: The object to receive the extender properties.
member.returns: true. if this object can provide extender properties to the specified object; otherwise, false..

id of HyperToolTip for the control to find content,

id of HyperToolTip for the control to find content. If

member.name: M:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HyperToolTipProvider.GetFileName(System.String)
member.summary: Maps to filenames inside CHM file. It is required because file name can have additional suffixes that used e.g. to specify tip window size.

filename inside CHM that corresponds to id passed,
null. if file for this id wasn't found.

member.name: M:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HyperToolTipProvider.GetTipInfo(System.Object)
member.summary: Builds Tip's content url using values set with and If specifies relative path then is user to combine a full path. Can be overwritten to define another url scheme to find tips' content. Also extract other tip attibutes that can be specified by documentor in tip's content file.
member.param: An item ( or ) for which Tip will be displayed.
member.returns: filled with information about the hypertooltip if it is defined and to be shown, null. othewize (if hypertooltip is not defined for this control).

member.name: M:Tekla.UI.HyperToolTips.HyperToolTipProvider.ShowTip(System.Object)
member.summary: This methos called when it is actually time to show the popup tip window. The method should determine whether hypertooltip should be shown (is defined) or not. It is responsible for attaching all nesesary handlers to track mouse etc. to hide tip window on a right time.
